story:
Once upon a time, in a land far, far away, there was a young boy named Tommy. Tommy was a kind and curious boy who loved to explore the world around him. He lived in a small village at the edge of the forest, where the trees seemed to touch the sky and the animals played all day long.

One day, as Tommy was wandering through the forest, he came across a small, hidden clearing. In the center of the clearing was a beautiful, golden apple tree. The tree was laden with the most delicious-looking apples Tommy had ever seen.

Tommy couldn't resist the temptation, and he reached up to pick one of the apples. But as soon as he touched it, the tree began to glow and a soft, musical voice whispered, "Thank you for picking me, Tommy. But before you eat me, I must tell you a story."

Tommy was surprised, but he listened closely as the apple began to tell him a tale of magic and adventure. It spoke of a kingdom far away, ruled by a wise and just queen. The queen had a precious treasure, a golden apple that could grant one wish to whoever ate it.

But the apple was stolen by a wicked sorcerer, who used its power to take over the kingdom and enslave its people. The queen and her bravest knights set out on a quest to retrieve the apple and save their kingdom.

They traveled through treacherous mountains and dark forests, facing many dangers along the way. But they never gave up, and finally, they reached the sorcerer's castle.

The queen bravely fought the sorcerer, and with the help of the golden apple, she was able to defeat him and return peace to the kingdom.

As the apple finished its story, it glowed brighter and brighter, until it was too hot for Tommy to hold. He let go, and the apple soared up into the sky, leaving a trail of golden light behind it.

Tommy returned home, his heart filled with the magic of the golden apple. From that day on, he never forgot the lesson he had learned: with bravery and determination, anything is possible.

And with that, my dear son, it's time for you to close your eyes and drift off to sleep. Sweet dreams.
